intro: Oxyglossellum, commonly known as the "dwarf golden saxifrage," is a small, hardy plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Saxifragaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in well-drained, sunny environments. Its leaves are usually succulent and fleshy, adapted to conserve moisture in harsh conditions. Oxyglossellum is often found in mountainous areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
